items.title: AI is gutting workforces—and an ex-Google exec says CEOs are too busy ‘celebrating’ their efficiency gains to see they’re next
items.description: Google’s former chief business officer Mo Gawdat says that the notion AI will create jobs is ‘100% crap’. He warns it’ll wipe out jobs, with even ‘inc...

items.title: Spending on AI data centers is so massive that it’s now two-thirds of GDP—and it could crash the American economy
items.description: As Rusty Foster, author of the widely read media blog Today in Tabs, puts it: "our economy might just be three AI data centers in a trench coat."

items.title: A bright spot for Tesla shareholders: Under Elon Musk’s new $27 comp package, their fate is now intertwined with his
items.description: If shareholders suffer over the next five years, so will Musk.

items.title: Fearing tariff-induced price hikes, parents are back-to-school shopping earlier than any year on record
items.description: More than two-thirds of families started buying pencils, pens, paper and folders in early July.

items.title: The ultra-wealthy expect hotel-level amenities for their homes—and developers are racing to keep up
items.description: A simple pool and gym aren’t enough to attract wealthy residents anymore.
